decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of  five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Samples of materials to be used for external finishes including timber window frames, facing brick and roof tile and band causing details to front and flank walls shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced.  This condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have given in this application.  The development shall thereafter be carried out in accordance with the approved details.  REASON:  To ensure that the extension fully harmonises with the house and surroundings. | No new window or other openings shall be made in the extension hereby approved without prior planning permssion.  REASON:  To protect the privacy of neighbours.
description: Two storey extension to side of house
